verses.text: They brought up an evil report of the land which they had spied out to the children of Israel, saying, “The land, through which we have gone to spy it out, is a land that eats up its inhabitants; and all the people who we saw in it are men of great stature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There we saw the Nephilim, the sons of Anak, who come from the Nephilim. We were in our own sight as grasshoppers, and so we were in their sight.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the congregation lifted up their voice, and cried; and the people wept that night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron. The whole congregation said to them, “We wish that we had died in the land of Egypt, or that we had died in this wilderness!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why does Yahweh bring us to this land, to fall by the sword? Our wives and our little ones will be captured or killed! Wouldn’t it be better for us to return into Egypt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to one another, “Let’s choose a leader, and let’s return into Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assembly of the congregation of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, who were of those who spied out the land, tore their clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They spoke to all the congregation of the children of Israel, saying, “The land, which we passed through to spy it out, is an exceedingly good land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If Yahweh delights in us, then he will bring us into this land, and give it to us: a land which flows with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only don’t rebel against Yahweh, neither fear the people of the land; for they are bread for us. Their defense is removed from over them, and Yahweh is with us. Don’t fear them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But all the congregation threatened to stone them with stones.
Yahweh’s glory appeared in the Tent of Meeting to all the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Moses, “How long will this people despise me? How long will they not believe in me, for all the signs which I have worked among them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will strike them with the pestilence, and disinherit them, and will make of you a nation greater and mightier than they.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to Yahweh, “Then the Egyptians will hear it; for you brought up this people in your might from among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will tell it to the inhabitants of this land. They have heard that you Yahweh are among this people; for you Yahweh are seen face to face, and your cloud stands over them, and you go before them, in a pillar of cloud by day, and in a pillar of fire by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if you killed this people as one man, then the nations which have heard the fame of you will speak, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Because Yahweh was not able to bring this people into the land which he swore to them, therefore he has slain them in the wilderness.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now please let the power of the Lord be great, according as you have spoken, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Yahweh is slow to anger, and abundant in loving kindness, forgiving iniquity and disobedience; and he will by no means clear the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children, on the third and on the fourth generation.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please pardon the iniquity of this people according to the greatness of your loving kindness, and just as you have forgiven this people, from Egypt even until now.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said, “I have pardoned according to your word;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but in very deed—as I live, and as all the earth shall be filled with Yahweh’s glory—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because all those men who have seen my glory and my signs, which I worked in Egypt and in the wilderness, yet have tempted me these ten times, and have not listened to my voice;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: surely they shall not see the land which I swore to their fathers, neither shall any of those who despised me see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But my servant Caleb, because he had another spirit with him, and has followed me fully, him I will bring into the land into which he went. His offspring shall possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since the Amalekite and the Canaanite dwell in the valley, tomorrow turn and go into the wilderness by the way to the Red Sea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How long shall I bear with this evil congregation that complain against me? I have heard the complaints of the children of Israel, which they complain against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell them, ‘As I live, says Yahweh, surely as you have spoken in my ears, so I will do to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your dead bodies shall fall in this wilderness; and all who were counted of you, according to your whole number, from twenty years old and upward, who have complained against me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: surely you shall not come into the land concerning which I swore that I would make you dwell therein, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh, and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will bring in your little ones that you said should be captured or killed, and they shall know the land which you have rejected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, your dead bodies shall fall in this wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your children shall be wanderers in the wilderness forty years, and shall bear your prostitution, until your dead bodies are consumed in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the number of the days in which you spied out the land, even forty days, for every day a year, you will bear your iniquities, even forty years, and you will know my alienation.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Yahweh, have spoken. I will surely do this to all this evil congregation who are gathered together against me. In this wilderness they shall be consumed, and there they shall die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men whom Moses sent to spy out the land, who returned and made all the congregation to murmur against him by bringing up an evil report against the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even those men who brought up an evil report of the land, died by the plague before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joshua the son of Nun and Caleb the son of Jephunneh remained alive of those men who went to spy out the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses told these words to all the children of Israel, and the people mourned greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They rose up early in the morning and went up to the top of the mountain, saying, “Behold, we are here, and will go up to the place which Yahweh has promised; for we have sinned.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said, “Why now do you disobey the commandment of Yahweh, since it shall not prosper?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t go up, for Yahweh isn’t among you; that way you won’t be struck down before your enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there the Amalekite and the Canaanite are before you, and you will fall by the sword because you turned back from following Yahweh; therefore Yahweh will not be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they presumed to go up to the top of the mountain. Nevertheless, the ark of Yahweh’s covenant and Moses didn’t depart out of the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Amalekites came down, and the Canaanites who lived in that mountain, and struck them and beat them down even to Hormah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘When you have come into the land of your habitations, which I give to you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will make an offering by fire to Yahweh—a burnt offering, or a sacrifice, to accomplish a vow, or as a free will offering, or in your set feasts, to make a pleasant aroma to Yahweh, of the herd, or of the flock—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he who offers his offering shall offer to Yahweh a meal offering of one tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with one fourth of a hin of oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall prepare wine for the drink offering, one fourth of a hin, with the burnt offering or for the sacrifice, for each lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘For a ram, you shall prepare for a meal offering two tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with the third part of a hin of oil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the drink offering you shall offer the third part of a hin of wine, of a pleasant aroma to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you prepare a bull for a burnt offering or for a sacrifice, to accomplish a vow, or for peace offerings to Yahweh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he shall offer with the bull a meal offering of three tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with half a hin of oil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall offer for the drink offering half a hin of wine, for an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus it shall be done for each bull, for each ram, for each of the male lambs, or of the young goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the number that you shall prepare, so you shall do to everyone according to their number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘All who are native-born shall do these things in this way, in offering an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a stranger lives as a foreigner with you, or whoever may be among you throughout your generations, and will offer an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to Yahweh, as you do, so he shall do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the assembly, there shall be one statute for you and for the stranger who lives as a foreigner, a statute forever throughout your generations. As you are, so the foreigner shall be before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One law and one ordinance shall be for you and for the stranger who lives as a foreigner with you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘When you come into the land where I bring you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then it shall be that when you eat of the bread of the land, you shall offer up a wave offering to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the first of your dough you shall offer up a cake for a wave offering. As the wave offering of the threshing floor, so you shall heave it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the first of your dough, you shall give to Yahweh a wave offering throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘When you err, and don’t observe all these commandments which Yahweh has spoken to Moses—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even all that Yahweh has commanded you by Moses, from the day that Yahweh gave commandment and onward throughout your generations—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then it shall be, if it was done unwittingly, without the knowledge of the congregation, that all the congregation shall offer one young bull for a burnt offering, for a pleasant aroma to Yahweh, with its meal offering and its drink offering, according to the ordinance, and one male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest shall make atonement for all the congregation of the children of Israel, and they shall be forgiven; for it was an error, and they have brought their offering, an offering made by fire to Yahweh, and their sin offering before Yahweh, for their error.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the congregation of the children of Israel shall be forgiven, as well as the stranger who lives as a foreigner among them; for with regard to all the people, it was done unwittingly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘If a person sins unwittingly, then he shall offer a female goat a year old for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest shall make atonement for the soul who errs when he sins unwittingly before Yahweh. He shall make atonement for him; and he shall be forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall have one law for him who does anything unwittingly, for him who is native-born among the children of Israel, and for the stranger who lives as a foreigner among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘But the soul who does anything with a high hand, whether he is native-born or a foreigner, blasphemes Yahweh. That soul shall be cut off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because he has despised Yahweh’s word, and has broken his commandment, that soul shall be utterly cut off. His iniquity shall be on him.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the children of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man gathering sticks on the Sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who found him gathering sticks brought him to Moses and Aaron, and to all the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They put him in custody, because it had not been declared what should be done to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Moses, “The man shall surely be put to death. All the congregation shall stone him with stones outside of the camp.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the congregation brought him outside of the camp, and stoned him to death with stones, as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them that they should make themselves fringes on the borders of their garments throughout their generations, and that they put on the fringe of each border a cord of blue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be to you for a fringe, that you may see it, and remember all Yahweh’s commandments, and do them; and that you don’t follow your own heart and your own eyes, after which you used to play the prostitute;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you may remember and do all my commandments, and be holy to your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am Yahweh your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am Yahweh your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Korah, the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, with Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, and On, the son of Peleth, sons of Reuben, took some men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They rose up before Moses, with some of the children of Israel, two hundred fifty princes of the congregation, called to the assembly, men of renown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They assembled themselves together against Moses and against Aaron, and said to them, “You take too much on yourself, since all the congregation are holy, everyone of them, and Yahweh is among them! Why do you lift yourselves up above Yahweh’s assembly?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses heard it, he fell on his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to Korah and to all his company, “In the morning, Yahweh will show who are his, and who is holy, and will cause him to come near to him. Even him whom he shall choose, he will cause to come near to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do this: have Korah and all his company take censers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: put fire in them, and put incense on them before Yahweh tomorrow. It shall be that the man whom Yahweh chooses, he shall be holy. You have gone too far, you sons of Levi!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to Korah, “Hear now, you sons of Levi!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it a small thing to you that the God of Israel has separated you from the congregation of Israel, to bring you near to himself, to do the service of Yahweh’s tabernacle, and to stand before the congregation to minister to them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that he has brought you near, and all your brothers the sons of Levi with you? Do you seek the priesthood also?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you and all your company have gathered together against Yahweh! What is Aaron that you complain against him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses sent to call Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab; and they said, “We won’t come up!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it a small thing that you have brought us up out of a land flowing with milk and honey, to kill us in the wilderness, but you must also make yourself a prince over us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover you haven’t brought us into a land flowing with milk and honey, nor given us inheritance of fields and vineyards. Will you put out the eyes of these men? We won’t come up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses was very angry, and said to Yahweh, “Don’t respect their offering. I have not taken one donkey from them, neither have I hurt one of them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to Korah, “You and all your company go before Yahweh, you, and they, and Aaron, tomorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each man take his censer and put incense on it, and each man bring before Yahweh his censer, two hundred fifty censers; you also, and Aaron, each with his censer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They each took his censer, and put fire in it, and laid incense on it, and stood at the door of the Tent of Meeting with Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Korah assembled all the congregation opposite them to the door of the Tent of Meeting.
Yahweh’s glory appeared to all the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Separate yourselves from among this congregation, that I may consume them in a moment!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They fell on their faces, and said, “God, the God of the spirits of all flesh, shall one man sin, and will you be angry with all the congregation?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the congregation, saying, ‘Get away from around the tent of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses rose up and went to Dathan and Abiram; and the elders of Israel followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He spoke to the congregation, saying, “Depart, please, from the tents of these wicked men, and touch nothing of theirs, lest you be consumed in all their sins!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went away from the tent of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram, on every side. Dathan and Abiram came out, and stood at the door of their tents with their wives, their sons, and their little ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said, “Hereby you shall know that Yahweh has sent me to do all these works; for they are not from my own mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If these men die the common death of all men, or if they experience what all men experience, then Yahweh hasn’t sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if Yahweh makes a new thing, and the ground opens its mouth, and swallows them up with all that belong to them, and they go down alive into Sheol, then you shall understand that these men have despised Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he finished speaking all these words, the ground that was under them split apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up with their households, all of Korah’s men, and all their goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they, and all that belonged to them went down alive into Sheol. The earth closed on them, and they perished from among the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Israel that were around them fled at their cry; for they said, “Lest the earth swallow us up!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fire came out from Yahweh, and devoured the two hundred fifty men who offered the incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, that he take up the censers out of the burning, and scatter the fire away from the camp; for they are holy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even the censers of those who sinned against their own lives. Let them be beaten into plates for a covering of the altar, for they offered them before Yahweh. Therefore they are holy. They shall be a sign to the children of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eleazar the priest took the bronze censers which those who were burned had offered; and they beat them out for a covering of the altar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to be a memorial to the children of Israel, to the end that no stranger who isn’t of the offspring of Aaron, would come near to burn incense before Yahweh, that he not be as Korah and as his company; as Yahweh spoke to him by Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the next day all the congregation of the children of Israel complained against Moses and against Aaron, saying, “You have killed Yahweh’s people!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the congregation was assembled against Moses and against Aaron, they looked toward the Tent of Meeting. Behold, the cloud covered it, and Yahweh’s glory appeared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Aaron came to the front of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Get away from among this congregation, that I may consume them in a moment!” They fell on their faces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to Aaron, “Take your censer, put fire from the altar in it, lay incense on it, carry it quickly to the congregation, and make atonement for them; for wrath has gone out from Yahweh! The plague has begun.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron did as Moses said, and ran into the middle of the assembly. The plague had already begun among the people. He put on the incense, and made atonement for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stood between the dead and the living; and the plague was stayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those who died by the plague were fourteen thousand seven hundred, in addition to those who died about the matter of Korah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron returned to Moses to the door of the Tent of Meeting, and the plague was stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the children of Israel, and take rods from them, one for each fathers’ house, of all their princes according to their fathers’ houses, twelve rods. Write each man’s name on his rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall write Aaron’s name on Levi’s rod. There shall be one rod for each head of their fathers’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall lay them up in the Tent of Meeting before the covenant, where I meet with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall happen that the rod of the man whom I shall choose shall bud. I will make the murmurings of the children of Israel, which they murmur against you, cease from me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses spoke to the children of Israel; and all their princes gave him rods, for each prince one, according to their fathers’ houses, a total of twelve rods. Aaron’s rod was among their rods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses laid up the rods before Yahweh in the Tent of the Testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day, Moses went into the Tent of the Testimony; and behold, Aaron’s rod for the house of Levi had sprouted, budded, produced blossoms, and bore ripe almonds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses brought out all the rods from before Yahweh to all the children of Israel. They looked, and each man took his rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Moses, “Put back the rod of Aaron before the covenant, to be kept for a token against the children of rebellion; that you may make an end of their complaining against me, that they not die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses did so. As Yahweh commanded him, so he did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel spoke to Moses, saying, “Behold, we perish! We are undone! We are all undone!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who keeps approaching Yahweh’s tabernacle, dies! Will we all perish?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Aaron, “You and your sons and your fathers’ house with you shall bear the iniquity of the sanctuary; and you and your sons with you shall bear the iniquity of your priesthood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring your brothers also, the tribe of Levi, the tribe of your father, near with you, that they may be joined to you, and minister to you; but you and your sons with you shall be before the Tent of the Testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall keep your commands and the duty of the whole Tent; only they shall not come near to the vessels of the sanctuary and to the altar, that they not die, neither they nor you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall be joined to you and keep the responsibility of the Tent of Meeting, for all the service of the Tent. A stranger shall not come near to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall perform the duty of the sanctuary and the duty of the altar, that there be no more wrath on the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I myself have taken your brothers the Levites from among the children of Israel. They are a gift to you, dedicated to Yahweh, to do the service of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You and your sons with you shall keep your priesthood for everything of the altar, and for that within the veil. You shall serve. I give you the service of the priesthood as a gift. The stranger who comes near shall be put to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Aaron, “Behold, I myself have given you the command of my wave offerings, even all the holy things of the children of Israel. I have given them to you by reason of the anointing, and to your sons, as a portion forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This shall be yours of the most holy things from the fire: every offering of theirs, even every meal offering of theirs, and every sin offering of theirs, and every trespass offering of theirs, which they shall render to me, shall be most holy for you and for your sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall eat of it like the most holy things. Every male shall eat of it. It shall be holy to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is yours, too: the wave offering of their gift, even all the wave offerings of the children of Israel. I have given them to you, and to your sons and to your daughters with you, as a portion forever. Everyone who is clean in your house shall eat of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have given to you all the best of the oil, all the best of the vintage, and of the grain, the first fruits of them which they give to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first-ripe fruits of all that is in their land, which they bring to Yahweh, shall be yours. Everyone who is clean in your house shall eat of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Everything devoted in Israel shall be yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything that opens the womb, of all flesh which they offer to Yahweh, both of man and animal, shall be yours. Nevertheless, you shall surely redeem the firstborn of man, and you shall redeem the firstborn of unclean animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall redeem those who are to be redeemed of them from a month old, according to your estimation, for five shekels of money, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, which weighs twenty gerahs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But you shall not redeem the firstborn of a cow, or the firstborn of a sheep, or the firstborn of a goat. They are holy. You shall sprinkle their blood on the altar, and shall burn their fat for an offering made by fire, for a pleasant aroma to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their meat shall be yours, as the wave offering breast and as the right thigh, it shall be yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the wave offerings of the holy things which the children of Israel offer to Yahweh, I have given you and your sons and your daughters with you, as a portion forever. It is a covenant of salt forever before Yahweh to you and to your offspring with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Aaron, “You shall have no inheritance in their land, neither shall you have any portion among them. I am your portion and your inheritance among the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “To the children of Levi, behold, I have given all the tithe in Israel for an inheritance, in return for their service which they serve, even the service of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Henceforth the children of Israel shall not come near the Tent of Meeting, lest they bear sin, and die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Levites shall do the service of the Tent of Meeting, and they shall bear their iniquity. It shall be a statute forever throughout your generations. Among the children of Israel, they shall have no inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the tithe of the children of Israel, which they offer as a wave offering to Yahweh, I have given to the Levites for an inheritance. Therefore I have said to them, ‘Among the children of Israel they shall have no inheritance.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Moreover you shall speak to the Levites, and tell them, ‘When you take of the children of Israel the tithe which I have given you from them for your inheritance, then you shall offer up a wave offering of it for Yahweh, a tithe of the tithe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your wave offering shall be credited to you, as though it were the grain of the threshing floor, and as the fullness of the wine press.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus you also shall offer a wave offering to Yahweh of all your tithes, which you receive of the children of Israel; and of it you shall give Yahweh’s wave offering to Aaron the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of all your gifts, you shall offer every wave offering to Yahweh, of all its best parts, even the holy part of it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore you shall tell them, ‘When you heave its best from it, then it shall be credited to the Levites as the increase of the threshing floor, and as the increase of the wine press.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may eat it anywhere, you and your households, for it is your reward in return for your service in the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall bear no sin by reason of it, when you have heaved from it its best. You shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, that you not die.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the statute of the law which Yahweh has commanded. Tell the children of Israel to bring you a red heifer without spot, in which is no defect, and which was never yoked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall give her to Eleazar the priest, and he shall bring her outside of the camp, and one shall kill her before his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eleazar the priest shall take some of her blood with his finger, and sprinkle her blood toward the front of the Tent of Meeting seven times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One shall burn the heifer in his sight; her skin, and her meat, and her blood, with her dung, shall he burn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest shall take cedar wood, hyssop, and scarlet, and cast it into the middle of the burning of the heifer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest shall wash his clothes, and he shall bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp, and the priest shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who burns her shall wash his clothes in water, and bathe his flesh in water, and shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A man who is clean shall gather up the ashes of the heifer, and lay them up outside of the camp in a clean place; and it shall be kept for the congregation of the children of Israel for use in water for cleansing impurity. It is a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who gathers the ashes of the heifer shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the evening. It shall be to the children of Israel, and to the stranger who lives as a foreigner among them, for a statute forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He who touches the dead body of any man shall be unclean seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall purify himself with water on the third day, and on the seventh day he shall be clean; but if he doesn’t purify himself the third day, then the seventh day he shall not be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever touches a dead person, the body of a man who has died, and doesn’t purify himself, defiles Yahweh’s tabernacle; and that soul shall be cut off from Israel; because the water for impurity was not sprinkled on him, he shall be unclean. His uncleanness is yet on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the law when a man dies in a tent: everyone who comes into the tent, and everyone who is in the tent, shall be unclean seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every open vessel, which has no covering bound on it, is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever in the open field touches one who is slain with a sword, or a dead body, or a bone of a man, or a grave, shall be unclean seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the unclean, they shall take of the ashes of the burning of the sin offering; and running water shall be poured on them in a vessel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A clean person shall take hyssop, dip it in the water, and sprinkle it on the tent, on all the vessels, on the persons who were there, and on him who touched the bone, or the slain, or the dead, or the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The clean person shall sprinkle on the unclean on the third day, and on the seventh day. On the seventh day, he shall purify him. He shall wash his clothes and bathe himself in water, and shall be clean at evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the man who shall be unclean, and shall not purify himself, that soul shall be cut off from among the assembly, because he has defiled the sanctuary of Yahweh. The water for impurity has not been sprinkled on him. He is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be a perpetual statute to them. He who sprinkles the water for impurity shall wash his clothes, and he who touches the water for impurity shall be unclean until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whatever the unclean person touches shall be unclean; and the soul that touches it shall be unclean until evening.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel, even the whole congregation, came into the wilderness of Zin in the first month. The people stayed in Kadesh. Miriam died there, and was buried there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was no water for the congregation; and they assembled themselves together against Moses and against Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people quarreled with Moses, and spoke, saying, “We wish that we had died when our brothers died before Yahweh!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why have you brought Yahweh’s assembly into this wilderness, that we should die there, we and our animals?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why have you made us to come up out of Egypt, to bring us in to this evil place? It is no place of seed, or of figs, or of vines, or of pomegranates; neither is there any water to drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Aaron went from the presence of the assembly to the door of the Tent of Meeting, and fell on their faces. Yahweh’s glory appeared to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the rod, and assemble the congregation, you, and Aaron your brother, and speak to the rock before their eyes, that it pour out its water. You shall bring water to them out of the rock; so you shall give the congregation and their livestock drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses took the rod from before Yahweh, as he commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Aaron gathered the assembly together before the rock, and he said to them, “Hear now, you rebels! Shall we bring water out of this rock for you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses lifted up his hand, and struck the rock with his rod twice, and water came out abundantly. The congregation and their livestock drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Moses and Aaron, “Because you didn’t believe in me, to sanctify me in the eyes of the children of Israel, therefore you shall not bring this assembly into the land which I have given them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the waters of Meribah; because the children of Israel strove with Yahweh, and he was sanctified in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moses sent messengers from Kadesh to the king of Edom, saying:
“Your brother Israel says: You know all the travail that has happened to us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how our fathers went down into Egypt, and we lived in Egypt a long time. The Egyptians mistreated us and our fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When we cried to Yahweh, he heard our voice, sent an angel, and brought us out of Egypt. Behold, we are in Kadesh, a city in the edge of your border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Please let us pass through your land. We will not pass through field or through vineyard, neither will we drink from the water of the wells. We will go along the king’s highway. We will not turn away to the right hand nor to the left, until we have passed your border.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Edom said to him, “You shall not pass through me, lest I come out with the sword against you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel said to him, “We will go up by the highway; and if we drink your water, I and my livestock, then I will give its price. Only let me, without doing anything else, pass through on my feet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “You shall not pass through.” Edom came out against him with many people, and with a strong hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Edom refused to give Israel passage through his border, so Israel turned away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Kadesh, and the children of Israel, even the whole congregation, came to Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses and Aaron in Mount Hor, by the border of the land of Edom, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Aaron shall be gathered to his people; for he shall not enter into the land which I have given to the children of Israel, because you rebelled against my word at the waters of Meribah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take Aaron and Eleazar his son, and bring them up to Mount Hor;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and strip Aaron of his garments, and put them on Eleazar his son. Aaron shall be gathered, and shall die there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses did as Yahweh commanded. They went up onto Mount Hor in the sight of all the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses stripped Aaron of his garments, and put them on Eleazar his son. Aaron died there on the top of the mountain, and Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the congregation saw that Aaron was dead, they wept for Aaron thirty days, even all the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Canaanite, the king of Arad, who lived in the South, heard that Israel came by the way of Atharim. He fought against Israel, and took some of them captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel vowed a vow to Yahweh, and said, “If you will indeed deliver this people into my hand, then I will utterly destroy their cities.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh listened to the voice of Israel, and delivered up the Canaanites; and they utterly destroyed them and their cities. The name of the place was called Hormah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Mount Hor by the way to the Red Sea, to go around the land of Edom. The soul of the people was very discouraged because of the journey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people spoke against God and against Moses: “Why have you brought us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? For there is no bread, there is no water, and our soul loathes this disgusting food!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh sent venomous snakes among the people, and they bit the people. Many people of Israel died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people came to Moses, and said, “We have sinned, because we have spoken against Yahweh and against you. Pray to Yahweh, that he take away the serpents from us.” Moses prayed for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Moses, “Make a venomous snake, and set it on a pole. It shall happen that everyone who is bitten, when he sees it, shall live.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses made a serpent of bronze, and set it on the pole. If a serpent had bitten any man, when he looked at the serpent of bronze, he lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel traveled, and encamped in Oboth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Oboth, and encamped at Iyeabarim, in the wilderness which is before Moab, toward the sunrise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they traveled, and encamped in the valley of Zered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they traveled, and encamped on the other side of the Arnon, which is in the wilderness that comes out of the border of the Amorites; for the Arnon is the border of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore it is said in The Book of the Wars of Yahweh, “Vaheb in Suphah, the valleys of the Arnon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the slope of the valleys that incline toward the dwelling of Ar, leans on the border of Moab.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they traveled to Beer; that is the well of which Yahweh said to Moses, “Gather the people together, and I will give them water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Israel sang this song:
“Spring up, well! Sing to it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the well, which the princes dug,
    which the nobles of the people dug,
    with the scepter, and with their poles.”
From the wilderness they traveled to Mattanah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from Mattanah to Nahaliel; and from Nahaliel to Bamoth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from Bamoth to the valley that is in the field of Moab, to the top of Pisgah, which looks down on the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let me pass through your land. We will not turn away into field or vineyard. We will not drink of the water of the wells. We will go by the king’s highway, until we have passed your border.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sihon would not allow Israel to pass through his border, but Sihon gathered all his people together, and went out against Israel into the wilderness, and came to Jahaz. He fought against Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel struck him with the edge of the sword, and possessed his land from the Arnon to the Jabbok, even to the children of Ammon; for the border of the children of Ammon was fortified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel took all these cities. Israel lived in all the cities of the Amorites, in Heshbon, and in all its villages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Heshbon was the city of Sihon the king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab, and taken all his land out of his hand, even to the Arnon.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
for a fire has gone out of Heshbon,
    a flame from the city of Sihon.
It has devoured Ar of Moab,
    The lords of the high places of the Arnon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to you, Moab!
    You are undone, people of Chemosh!
He has given his sons as fugitives,
    and his daughters into captivity,
    to Sihon king of the Amorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have shot at them.
    Heshbon has perished even to Dibon.
We have laid waste even to Nophah,
    Which reaches to Medeba.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Israel lived in the land of the Amorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses sent to spy out Jazer. They took its villages, and drove out the Amorites who were there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They turned and went up by the way of Bashan. Og the king of Bashan went out against them, he and all his people, to battle at Edrei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Moses, “Don’t fear him, for I have delivered him into your hand, with all his people, and his land. You shall do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they struck him, with his sons and all his people, until there were no survivors; and they possessed his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel traveled, and encamped in the plains of Moab beyond the Jordan at Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak the son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moab was very afraid of the people, because they were many. Moab was distressed because of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moab said to the elders of Midian, “Now this multitude will lick up all that is around us, as the ox licks up the grass of the field.”
Balak the son of Zippor was king of Moab at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent messengers to Balaam the son of Beor, to Pethor, which is by the River, to the land of the children of his people, to call him, saying, “Behold, there is a people who came out of Egypt. Behold, they cover the surface of the earth, and they are staying opposite me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Please come now therefore, and curse this people for me; for they are too mighty for me. Perhaps I shall prevail, that we may strike them, and that I may drive them out of the land; for I know that he whom you bless is blessed, and he whom you curse is cursed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The elders of Moab and the elders of Midian departed with the rewards of divination in their hand. They came to Balaam, and spoke to him the words of Balak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “Lodge here this night, and I will bring you word again, as Yahweh shall speak to me.” The princes of Moab stayed with Balaam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God came to Balaam, and said, “Who are these men with you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam said to God, “Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, has said to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Behold, the people that has come out of Egypt covers the surface of the earth. Now, come curse them for me. Perhaps I shall be able to fight against them, and shall drive them out.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God said to Balaam, “You shall not go with them. You shall not curse the people, for they are blessed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam rose up in the morning, and said to the princes of Balak, “Go to your land; for Yahweh refuses to permit me to go with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The princes of Moab rose up, and they went to Balak, and said, “Balaam refuses to come with us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak again sent princes, more, and more honorable than they.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Balaam, and said to him, “Balak the son of Zippor says, ‘Please let nothing hinder you from coming to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I will promote you to very great honor, and whatever you say to me I will do. Please come therefore, and curse this people for me.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam answered the servants of Balak, “If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I can’t go beyond the word of Yahweh my God, to do less or more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore please stay here tonight as well, that I may know what else Yahweh will speak to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God came to Balaam at night, and said to him, “If the men have come to call you, rise up, go with them; but only the word which I speak to you, that you shall do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam rose up in the morning, and saddled his donkey, and went with the princes of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God’s anger burned because he went; and Yahweh’s angel placed himself in the way as an adversary against him. Now he was riding on his donkey, and his two servants were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The donkey saw Yahweh’s angel standing in the way, with his sword drawn in his hand; and the donkey turned out of the path, and went into the field. Balaam struck the donkey, to turn her into the path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh’s angel stood in a narrow path between the vineyards, a wall being on this side, and a wall on that side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The donkey saw Yahweh’s angel, and she thrust herself to the wall, and crushed Balaam’s foot against the wall. He struck her again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s angel went further, and stood in a narrow place, where there was no way to turn either to the right hand or to the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The donkey saw Yahweh’s angel, and she lay down under Balaam. Balaam’s anger burned, and he struck the donkey with his staff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh opened the mouth of the donkey, and she said to Balaam, “What have I done to you, that you have struck me these three times?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam said to the donkey, “Because you have mocked me, I wish there were a sword in my hand, for now I would have killed you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The donkey said to Balaam, “Am I not your donkey, on which you have ridden all your life long until today? Was I ever in the habit of doing so to you?”
He said, “No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Yahweh opened the eyes of Balaam, and he saw Yahweh’s angel standing in the way, with his sword drawn in his hand; and he bowed his head, and fell on his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s angel said to him, “Why have you struck your donkey these three times? Behold, I have come out as an adversary, because your way is perverse before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The donkey saw me, and turned away before me these three times. Unless she had turned away from me, surely now I would have killed you, and saved her alive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam said to Yahweh’s angel, “I have sinned; for I didn’t know that you stood in the way against me. Now therefore, if it displeases you, I will go back again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yahweh’s angel said to Balaam, “Go with the men; but you shall only speak the word that I shall speak to you.”
So Balaam went with the princes of Balak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Balak heard that Balaam had come, he went out to meet him to the City of Moab, which is on the border of the Arnon, which is in the utmost part of the border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak said to Balaam, “Didn’t I earnestly send for you to summon you? Why didn’t you come to me? Am I not able indeed to promote you to honor?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam said to Balak, “Behold, I have come to you. Have I now any power at all to speak anything? I will speak the word that God puts in my mouth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam went with Balak, and they came to Kiriath Huzoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak sacrificed cattle and sheep, and sent to Balaam, and to the princes who were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the morning, Balak took Balaam, and brought him up into the high places of Baal; and he saw from there part of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam said to Balak, “Build here seven altars for me, and prepare here seven bulls and seven rams for me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak did as Balaam had spoken; and Balak and Balaam offered on every altar a bull and a ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Balaam said to Balak, “Stand by your burnt offering, and I will go. Perhaps Yahweh will come to meet me. Whatever he shows me I will tell you.”
He went to a bare height.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God met Balaam, and he said to him, “I have prepared the seven altars, and I have offered up a bull and a ram on every altar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh put a word in Balaam’s mouth, and said, “Return to Balak, and thus you shall speak.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He returned to him, and behold, he was standing by his burnt offering, he, and all the princes of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He took up his parable, and said,
“From Aram has Balak brought me,
    the king of Moab from the mountains of the East.
Come, curse Jacob for me.
    Come, defy Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How shall I curse whom God has not cursed?
    How shall I defy whom Yahweh has not defied?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For from the top of the rocks I see him.
    From the hills I see him.
Behold, it is a people that dwells alone,
    and shall not be listed among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can count the dust of Jacob,
    or count the fourth part of Israel?
Let me die the death of the righteous!
    Let my last end be like his!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? I took you to curse my enemies, and behold, you have blessed them altogether.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered and said, “Must I not take heed to speak that which Yahweh puts in my mouth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak said to him, “Please come with me to another place, where you may see them. You shall see just part of them, and shall not see them all. Curse them from there for me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took him into the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, and offered up a bull and a ram on every altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to Balak, “Stand here by your burnt offering, while I meet God over there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh met Balaam, and put a word in his mouth, and said, “Return to Balak, and say this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to him, and behold, he was standing by his burnt offering, and the princes of Moab with him. Balak said to him, “What has Yahweh spoken?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He took up his parable, and said,
“Rise up, Balak, and hear!
    Listen to me, you son of Zippor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God is not a man, that he should lie,
    nor a son of man, that he should repent.
Has he said, and he won’t do it?
    Or has he spoken, and he won’t make it good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I have received a command to bless.
    He has blessed, and I can’t reverse it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has not seen iniquity in Jacob.
    Neither has he seen perverseness in Israel.
Yahweh his God is with him.
    The shout of a king is among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God brings them out of Egypt.
    He has as it were the strength of the wild ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely there is no enchantment with Jacob;
    neither is there any divination with Israel.
Now it shall be said of Jacob and of Israel,
    ‘What has God done!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, a people rises up as a lioness.
    As a lion he lifts himself up.
He shall not lie down until he eats of the prey,
    and drinks the blood of the slain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak said to Balaam, “Neither curse them at all, nor bless them at all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Balaam answered Balak, “Didn’t I tell you, saying, ‘All that Yahweh speaks, that I must do’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak said to Balaam, “Come now, I will take you to another place; perhaps it will please God that you may curse them for me from there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, that looks down on the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam said to Balak, “Build seven altars for me here, and prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered up a bull and a ram on every altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Balaam saw that it pleased Yahweh to bless Israel, he didn’t go, as at the other times, to use divination, but he set his face toward the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam lifted up his eyes, and he saw Israel dwelling according to their tribes; and the Spirit of God came on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
he says, who hears the words of God,
    who sees the vision of the Almighty,
    falling down, and having his eyes open:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How goodly are your tents, Jacob,
    and your dwellings, Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As valleys they are spread out,
    as gardens by the riverside,
    as aloes which Yahweh has planted,
    as cedar trees beside the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Water shall flow from his buckets.
    His seed shall be in many waters.
His king shall be higher than Agag.
    His kingdom shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God brings him out of Egypt.
    He has as it were the strength of the wild ox.
He shall consume the nations his adversaries,
    shall break their bones in pieces,
    and pierce them with his arrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He couched, he lay down as a lion,
    as a lioness;
    who shall rouse him up?
Everyone who blesses you is blessed.
    Everyone who curses you is cursed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balak’s anger burned against Balaam, and he struck his hands together. Balak said to Balaam, “I called you to curse my enemies, and, behold, you have altogether blessed them these three times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, flee to your place, now! I thought to promote you to great honor; but, behold, Yahweh has kept you back from honor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam said to Balak, “Didn’t I also tell your messengers whom you sent to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I can’t go beyond Yahweh’s word, to do either good or bad from my own mind. I will say what Yahweh says’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, behold, I go to my people. Come, I will inform you what this people shall do to your people in the latter days.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
he says, who hears the words of God,
    knows the knowledge of the Most High,
    and who sees the vision of the Almighty,
    falling down, and having his eyes open:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I see him, but not now.
    I see him, but not near.
A star will come out of Jacob.
    A scepter will rise out of Israel,
and shall strike through the corners of Moab,
    and crush all the sons of Sheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Edom shall be a possession.
    Seir, his enemy, also shall be a possession,
    while Israel does valiantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out of Jacob shall one have dominion,
    and shall destroy the remnant from the city.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He looked at Amalek, and took up his parable, and said,
“Amalek was the first of the nations,
    but his latter end shall come to destruction.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He looked at the Kenite, and took up his parable, and said,
“Your dwelling place is strong.
    Your nest is set in the rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nevertheless Kain shall be wasted,
    until Asshur carries you away captive.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He took up his parable, and said,
“Alas, who shall live when God does this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But ships shall come from the coast of Kittim.
They shall afflict Asshur, and shall afflict Eber.
    He also shall come to destruction.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Balaam rose up, and went and returned to his place; and Balak also went his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel stayed in Shittim; and the people began to play the prostitute with the daughters of Moab;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they called the people to the sacrifices of their gods. The people ate and bowed down to their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel joined himself to Baal Peor, and Yahweh’s anger burned against Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Moses, “Take all the chiefs of the people, and hang them up to Yahweh before the sun, that the fierce anger of Yahweh may turn away from Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to the judges of Israel, “Everyone kill his men who have joined themselves to Baal Peor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, one of the children of Israel came and brought to his brothers a Midianite woman in the sight of Moses, and in the sight of all the congregation of the children of Israel, while they were weeping at the door of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saw it, he rose up from the middle of the congregation, and took a spear in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went after the man of Israel into the pavilion, and thrust both of them through, the man of Israel, and the woman through her body. So the plague was stopped among the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who died by the plague were twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, has turned my wrath away from the children of Israel, in that he was jealous with my jealousy among them, so that I didn’t consume the children of Israel in my jealousy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore say, ‘Behold, I give to him my covenant of peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be to him, and to his offspring after him, the covenant of an everlasting priesthood, because he was jealous for his God, and made atonement for the children of Israel.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the name of the man of Israel that was slain, who was slain with the Midianite woman, was Zimri, the son of Salu, a prince of a fathers’ house among the Simeonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the Midianite woman who was slain was Cozbi, the daughter of Zur. He was head of the people of a fathers’ house in Midian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Harass the Midianites, and strike them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they harassed you with their wiles, wherein they have deceived you in the matter of Peor, and in the incident regarding Cozbi, the daughter of the prince of Midian, their sister, who was slain on the day of the plague in the matter of Peor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the plague, Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take a census of all the congregation of the children of Israel, from twenty years old and upward, by their fathers’ houses, all who are able to go out to war in Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Eleazar the priest spoke with them in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Take a census, from twenty years old and upward, as Yahweh commanded Moses and the children of Israel.”
These are those who came out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reuben, the firstborn of Israel; the sons of Reuben: of Hanoch, the family of the Hanochites; of Pallu, the family of the Palluites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites; of Carmi, the family of the Carmites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the Reubenites; and those who were counted of them were forty-three thousand seven hundred thirty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Pallu: Eliab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Eliab: Nemuel, Dathan, and Abiram. These are that Dathan and Abiram who were called by the congregation, who rebelled against Moses and against Aaron in the company of Korah when they rebelled against Yahweh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the earth opened its mouth, and swallowed them up together with Korah when that company died; at the time the fire devoured two hundred fifty men, and they became a sign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding, the sons of Korah didn’t die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Simeon after their families: of Nemuel, the family of the Nemuelites; of Jamin, the family of the Jaminites; of Jachin, the family of the Jachinites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Zerah, the family of the Zerahites; of Shaul, the family of the Shaulites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the Simeonites, twenty-two thousand two hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gad after their families: of Zephon, the family of the Zephonites; of Haggi, the family of the Haggites; of Shuni, the family of the Shunites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Ozni, the family of the Oznites; of Eri, the family of the Erites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Arod, the family of the Arodites; of Areli, the family of the Arelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the sons of Gad according to those who were counted of them, forty thousand and five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Judah: Er and Onan. Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Judah after their families were: of Shelah, the family of the Shelanites; of Perez, the family of the Perezites; of Zerah, the family of the Zerahites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Perez were: of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites; of Hamul, the family of the Hamulites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of Judah according to those who were counted of them, seventy-six thousand five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Issachar after their families: of Tola, the family of the Tolaites; of Puvah, the family of the Punites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Jashub, the family of the Jashubites; of Shimron, the family of the Shimronites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of Issachar according to those who were counted of them, sixty-four thousand three hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Zebulun after their families: of Sered, the family of the Seredites; of Elon, the family of the Elonites; of Jahleel, the family of the Jahleelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the Zebulunites according to those who were counted of them, sixty thousand five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Joseph after their families: Manasseh and Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Manasseh: of Machir, the family of the Machirites; and Machir became the father of Gilead; of Gilead, the family of the Gileadites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Gilead: of Iezer, the family of the Iezerites; of Helek, the family of the Helekites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Asriel, the family of the Asrielites; and Shechem, the family of the Shechemites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Shemida, the family of the Shemidaites; and Hepher, the family of the Hepherites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zelophehad the son of Hepher had no sons, but daughters: and the names of the daughters of Zelophehad were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of Manasseh. Those who were counted of them were fifty-two thousand seven hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Ephraim after their families: of Shuthelah, the family of the Shuthelahites; of Becher, the family of the Becherites; of Tahan, the family of the Tahanites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Shuthelah: of Eran, the family of the Eranites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the sons of Ephraim according to those who were counted of them, thirty-two thousand five hundred. These are the sons of Joseph after their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Benjamin after their families: of Bela, the family of the Belaites; of Ashbel, the family of the Ashbelites; of Ahiram, the family of the Ahiramites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Shephupham, the family of the Shuphamites; of Hupham, the family of the Huphamites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman: the family of the Ardites; and of Naaman, the family of the Naamites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Benjamin after their families; and those who were counted of them were forty-five thousand six hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Dan after their families: of Shuham, the family of the Shuhamites. These are the families of Dan after their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the families of the Shuhamites, according to those who were counted of them, were sixty-four thousand four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Asher after their families: of Imnah, the family of the Imnites; of Ishvi, the family of the Ishvites; of Beriah, the family of the Berites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Beriah: of Heber, the family of the Heberites; of Malchiel, the family of the Malchielites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the daughter of Asher was Serah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the sons of Asher according to those who were counted of them, fifty-three thousand four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Naphtali after their families: of Jahzeel, the family of the Jahzeelites; of Guni, the family of the Gunites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Jezer, the family of the Jezerites; of Shillem, the family of the Shillemites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of Naphtali according to their families; and those who were counted of them were forty-five thousand four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are those who were counted of the children of Israel, six hundred one thousand seven hundred thirty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “To these the land shall be divided for an inheritance according to the number of names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the more you shall give the more inheritance, and to the fewer you shall give the less inheritance. To everyone according to those who were counted of him shall his inheritance be given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding, the land shall be divided by lot. According to the names of the tribes of their fathers they shall inherit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the lot shall their inheritance be divided between the more and the fewer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are those who were counted of the Levites after their families: of Gershon, the family of the Gershonites; of Kohath, the family of the Kohathites; of Merari, the family of the Merarites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of Levi: the family of the Libnites, the family of the Hebronites, the family of the Mahlites, the family of the Mushites, and the family of the Korahites. Kohath became the father of Amram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of Amram’s wife was Jochebed, the daughter of Levi, who was born to Levi in Egypt. She bore to Amram Aaron and Moses, and Miriam their sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Aaron were born Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nadab and Abihu died when they offered strange fire before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who were counted of them were twenty-three thousand, every male from a month old and upward; for they were not counted among the children of Israel, because there was no inheritance given them among the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are those who were counted by Moses and Eleazar the priest, who counted the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But among these there was not a man of them who were counted by Moses and Aaron the priest, who counted the children of Israel in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Yahweh had said of them, “They shall surely die in the wilderness.” There was not a man left of them, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh, and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the daughters of Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of Manasseh the son of Joseph came near. These are the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They stood before Moses, before Eleazar the priest, and before the princes and all the congregation, at the door of the Tent of Meeting, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Our father died in the wilderness. He was not among the company of those who gathered themselves together against Yahweh in the company of Korah, but he died in his own sin. He had no sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should the name of our father be taken away from among his family, because he had no son? Give to us a possession among the brothers of our father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses brought their cause before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The daughters of Zelophehad speak right. You shall surely give them a possession of an inheritance among their father’s brothers. You shall cause the inheritance of their father to pass to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall speak to the children of Israel, saying, ‘If a man dies, and has no son, then you shall cause his inheritance to pass to his daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he has no daughter, then you shall give his inheritance to his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he has no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to his father’s brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If his father has no brothers, then you shall give his inheritance to his kinsman who is next to him of his family, and he shall possess it. This shall be a statute and ordinance for the children of Israel, as Yahweh commanded Moses.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Moses, “Go up into this mountain of Abarim, and see the land which I have given to the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you have seen it, you also shall be gathered to your people, as Aaron your brother was gathered;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because in the strife of the congregation, you rebelled against my word in the wilderness of Zin, to honor me as holy at the waters before their eyes.” (These are the waters of Meribah of Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses spoke to Yahweh, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Let Yahweh, the God of the spirits of all flesh, appoint a man over the congregation,
verses.speaker: Narrator
