verses.text: who may go out before them, and who may come in before them, and who may lead them out, and who may bring them in, that the congregation of Yahweh may not be as sheep which have no shepherd.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh said to Moses, “Take Joshua the son of Nun, a man in whom is the Spirit, and lay your hand on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set him before Eleazar the priest, and before all the congregation; and commission him in their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall give authority to him, that all the congregation of the children of Israel may obey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He shall stand before Eleazar the priest, who shall inquire for him by the judgment of the Urim before Yahweh. At his word they shall go out, and at his word they shall come in, both he and all the children of Israel with him, even all the congregation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses did as Yahweh commanded him. He took Joshua, and set him before Eleazar the priest and before all the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He laid his hands on him and commissioned him, as Yahweh spoke by Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘See that you present my offering, my food for my offerings made by fire, as a pleasant aroma to me, in their due season.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall tell them, ‘This is the offering made by fire which you shall offer to Yahweh: male lambs a year old without defect, two day by day, for a continual burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall offer the one lamb in the morning, and you shall offer the other lamb at evening,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with one tenth of an ephah of fine flour for a meal offering, mixed with the fourth part of a hin of beaten oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a continual burnt offering which was ordained in Mount Sinai for a pleasant aroma, an offering made by fire to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its drink offering shall be the fourth part of a hin for each lamb. You shall pour out a drink offering of strong drink to Yahweh in the holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other lamb you shall offer at evening. As the meal offering of the morning, and as its drink offering, you shall offer it, an offering made by fire, for a pleasant aroma to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the Sabbath day, you shall offer two male lambs a year old without defect, and two tenths of an ephah of fine flour for a meal offering mixed with oil, and its drink offering:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this is the burnt offering of every Sabbath, in addition to the continual burnt offering and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘In the beginnings of your months, you shall offer a burnt offering to Yahweh: two young bulls, one ram, seven male lambs a year old without defect,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and three tenths of an ephah of fine flour for a meal offering mixed with oil, for each bull; and two tenth parts of fine flour for a meal offering mixed with oil, for the one ram;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one tenth part of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering to every lamb, as a burnt offering of a pleasant aroma, an offering made by fire to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their drink offerings shall be half a hin of wine for a bull, the third part of a hin for the ram, and the fourth part of a hin for a lamb. This is the burnt offering of every month throughout the months of the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, one male goat for a sin offering to Yahweh shall be offered in addition to the continual burnt offering and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, is Yahweh’s Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fifteenth day of this month shall be a feast. Unleavened bread shall be eaten for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the first day shall be a holy convocation. You shall do no regular work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you shall offer an offering made by fire, a burnt offering to Yahweh: two young bulls, one ram, and seven male lambs a year old. They shall be without defect,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with their meal offering, fine flour mixed with oil. You shall offer three tenths for a bull, and two tenths for the ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall offer one tenth for every lamb of the seven lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering, to make atonement for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall offer these in addition to the burnt offering of the morning, which is for a continual burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this way you shall offer daily, for seven days, the food of the offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to Yahweh. It shall be offered in addition to the continual burnt offering and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day you shall have a holy convocation. You shall do no regular work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Also in the day of the first fruits, when you offer a new meal offering to Yahweh in your feast of weeks, you shall have a holy convocation. You shall do no regular work;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you shall offer a burnt offering for a pleasant aroma to Yahweh: two young bulls, one ram, seven male lambs a year old;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their meal offering, fine flour mixed with oil, three tenths for each bull, two tenths for the one ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one tenth for every lamb of the seven lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat, to make atonement for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Besides the continual burnt offering and its meal offering, you shall offer them and their drink offerings. See that they are without defect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you shall have a holy convocation; you shall do no regular work. It is a day of blowing of trumpets to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall offer a burnt offering for a pleasant aroma to Yahweh: one young bull, one ram, seven male lambs a year old without defect;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their meal offering, fine flour mixed with oil: three tenths for the bull, two tenths for the ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one tenth for every lamb of the seven lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering, to make atonement for you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in addition to the burnt offering of the new moon with its meal offering, and the continual burnt offering with its meal offering, and their drink offerings, according to their ordinance, for a pleasant aroma, an offering made by fire to Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the tenth day of this seventh month you shall have a holy convocation. You shall afflict your souls. You shall do no kind of work;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you shall offer a burnt offering to Yahweh for a pleasant aroma: one young bull, one ram, seven male lambs a year old, all without defect;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their meal offering, fine flour mixed with oil: three tenths for the bull, two tenths for the one ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one tenth for every lamb of the seven lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the sin offering of atonement, and the continual burnt offering, and its meal offering, and their drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the fifteenth day of the seventh month you shall have a holy convocation. You shall do no regular work. You shall keep a feast to Yahweh seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall offer a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to Yahweh: thirteen young bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old, all without defect;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their meal offering, fine flour mixed with oil: three tenths for every bull of the thirteen bulls, two tenths for each ram of the two rams,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one tenth for every lamb of the fourteen lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the continual burnt offering, its meal offering, and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the second day you shall offer twelve young bulls, two rams, and fourteen male lambs a year old without defect;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the continual burnt offering, with its meal offering and their drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the third day: eleven bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without defect;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the continual burnt offering, and its meal offering, and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the fourth day ten bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without defect;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering; in addition to the continual burnt offering, its meal offering, and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the fifth day: nine bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without defect;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the continual burnt offering, and its meal offering, and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the sixth day: eight bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without defect;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering; in addition to the continual burnt offering, its meal offering, and the drink offerings of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the seventh day: seven bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without defect;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering; in addition to the continual burnt offering, its meal offering, and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘On the eighth day you shall have a solemn assembly. You shall do no regular work;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you shall offer a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, a pleasant aroma to Yahweh: one bull, one ram, seven male lambs a year old without defect;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bull, for the ram, and for the lambs, shall be according to their number, after the ordinance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the continual burnt offering, with its meal offering, and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You shall offer these to Yahweh in your set feasts—in addition to your vows and your free will offerings—for your burnt offerings, your meal offerings, your drink offerings, and your peace offerings.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses told the children of Israel according to all that Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses spoke to the heads of the tribes of the children of Israel, saying, “This is the thing which Yahweh has commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a man vows a vow to Yahweh, or swears an oath to bind his soul with a bond, he shall not break his word. He shall do according to all that proceeds out of his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Also, when a woman vows a vow to Yahweh and binds herself by a pledge, being in her father’s house, in her youth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her father hears her vow and her pledge with which she has bound her soul, and her father says nothing to her, then all her vows shall stand, and every pledge with which she has bound her soul shall stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her father forbids her in the day that he hears, none of her vows or of her pledges with which she has bound her soul, shall stand. Yahweh will forgive her, because her father has forbidden her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If she has a husband, while her vows are on her, or the rash utterance of her lips with which she has bound her soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her husband hears it, and says nothing to her in the day that he hears it; then her vows shall stand, and her pledges with which she has bound her soul shall stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her husband forbids her in the day that he hears it, then he makes void her vow which is on her and the rash utterance of her lips, with which she has bound her soul. Yahweh will forgive her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the vow of a widow, or of her who is divorced, everything with which she has bound her soul shall stand against her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If she vowed in her husband’s house or bound her soul by a bond with an oath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her husband heard it, and held his peace at her and didn’t disallow her, then all her vows shall stand, and every pledge with which she bound her soul shall stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her husband made them null and void in the day that he heard them, then whatever proceeded out of her lips concerning her vows, or concerning the bond of her soul, shall not stand. Her husband has made them void. Yahweh will forgive her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every vow, and every binding oath to afflict the soul, her husband may establish it, or her husband may make it void.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her husband says nothing to her from day to day, then he establishes all her vows or all her pledges which are on her. He has established them, because he said nothing to her in the day that he heard them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he makes them null and void after he has heard them, then he shall bear her iniquity.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the statutes which Yahweh commanded Moses, between a man and his wife, between a father and his daughter, being in her youth, in her father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Avenge the children of Israel on the Midianites. Afterward you shall be gathered to your people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses spoke to the people, saying, “Arm men from among you for war, that they may go against Midian, to execute Yahweh’s vengeance on Midian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall send one thousand out of every tribe, throughout all the tribes of Israel, to the war.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there were delivered, out of the thousands of Israel, a thousand from every tribe, twelve thousand armed for war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses sent them, one thousand of every tribe, to the war with Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, to the war, with the vessels of the sanctuary and the trumpets for the alarm in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They fought against Midian, as Yahweh commanded Moses. They killed every male.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They killed the kings of Midian with the rest of their slain: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, the five kings of Midian. They also killed Balaam the son of Beor with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel took the women of Midian captive with their little ones; and all their livestock, all their flocks, and all their goods, they took as plunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All their cities in the places in which they lived, and all their encampments, they burned with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They took all the captives, and all the plunder, both of man and of animal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the captives with the prey and the plunder, to Moses, and to Eleazar the priest, and to the congregation of the children of Israel, to the camp at the plains of Moab, which are by the Jordan at Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Eleazar the priest, with all the princes of the congregation, went out to meet them outside of the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses was angry with the officers of the army, the captains of thousands and the captains of hundreds, who came from the service of the war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to them, “Have you saved all the women alive?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, these caused the children of Israel, through the counsel of Balaam, to commit trespass against Yahweh in the matter of Peor, and so the plague was among the congregation of Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore kill every male among the little ones, and kill every woman who has known man by lying with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all the girls, who have not known man by lying with him, keep alive for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Encamp outside of the camp for seven days. Whoever has killed any person, and whoever has touched any slain, purify yourselves on the third day and on the seventh day, you and your captives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall purify every garment, and all that is made of skin, and all work of goats’ hair, and all things made of wood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eleazar the priest said to the men of war who went to the battle, “This is the statute of the law which Yahweh has commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However the gold, and the silver, the bronze, the iron, the tin, and the lead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: everything that may withstand the fire, you shall make to go through the fire, and it shall be clean; nevertheless it shall be purified with the water for impurity. All that doesn’t withstand the fire you shall make to go through the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall wash your clothes on the seventh day, and you shall be clean. Afterward you shall come into the camp.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Count the plunder that was taken, both of man and of animal, you, and Eleazar the priest, and the heads of the fathers’ households of the congregation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and divide the plunder into two parts: between the men skilled in war, who went out to battle, and all the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Levy a tribute to Yahweh of the men of war who went out to battle: one soul of five hundred; of the persons, of the cattle, of the donkeys, and of the flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take it from their half, and give it to Eleazar the priest, for Yahweh’s wave offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the children of Israel’s half, you shall take one drawn out of every fifty, of the persons, of the cattle, of the donkeys, and of the flocks, of all the livestock, and give them to the Levites, who perform the duty of Yahweh’s tabernacle.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Eleazar the priest did as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the plunder, over and above the booty which the men of war took, was six hundred seventy-five thousand sheep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: seventy-two thousand head of cattle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: sixty-one thousand donkeys,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thirty-two thousand persons in all, of the women who had not known man by lying with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The half, which was the portion of those who went out to war, was in number three hundred thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Yahweh’s tribute of the sheep was six hundred seventy-five.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cattle were thirty-six thousand, of which Yahweh’s tribute was seventy-two.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The donkeys were thirty thousand five hundred, of which Yahweh’s tribute was sixty-one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The persons were sixteen thousand, of whom Yahweh’s tribute was thirty-two persons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses gave the tribute, which was Yahweh’s wave offering, to Eleazar the priest, as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the children of Israel’s half, which Moses divided off from the men who fought
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (now the congregation’s half was three hundred thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thirty-six thousand head of cattle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thirty thousand five hundred donkeys,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sixteen thousand persons),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even of the children of Israel’s half, Moses took one drawn out of every fifty, both of man and of animal, and gave them to the Levites, who performed the duty of Yahweh’s tabernacle, as Yahweh commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The officers who were over the thousands of the army, the captains of thousands, and the captains of hundreds, came near to Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to Moses, “Your servants have taken the sum of the men of war who are under our command, and there lacks not one man of us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have brought Yahweh’s offering, what every man found: gold ornaments, armlets, bracelets, signet rings, earrings, and necklaces, to make atonement for our souls before Yahweh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Eleazar the priest took their gold, even all worked jewels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the gold of the wave offering that they offered up to Yahweh, of the captains of thousands, and of the captains of hundreds, was sixteen thousand seven hundred fifty shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of war had taken booty, every man for himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold of the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and brought it into the Tent of Meeting for a memorial for the children of Israel before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the children of Reuben and the children of Gad had a very great multitude of livestock. They saw the land of Jazer, and the land of Gilead. Behold, the place was a place for livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the children of Gad and the children of Reuben came and spoke to Moses, and to Eleazar the priest, and to the princes of the congregation, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo, and Beon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the land which Yahweh struck before the congregation of Israel, is a land for livestock; and your servants have livestock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “If we have found favor in your sight, let this land be given to your servants for a possession. Don’t bring us over the Jordan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to the children of Gad, and to the children of Reuben, “Shall your brothers go to war while you sit here?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you discourage the heart of the children of Israel from going over into the land which Yahweh has given them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your fathers did so when I sent them from Kadesh Barnea to see the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when they went up to the valley of Eshcol, and saw the land, they discouraged the heart of the children of Israel, that they should not go into the land which Yahweh had given them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s anger burned in that day, and he swore, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Surely none of the men who came up out of Egypt, from twenty years old and upward, shall see the land which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob; because they have not wholly followed me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: except Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, and Joshua the son of Nun, because they have followed Yahweh completely.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh’s anger burned against Israel, and he made them wander back and forth in the wilderness forty years, until all the generation who had done evil in Yahweh’s sight was consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, you have risen up in your fathers’ place, an increase of sinful men, to increase the fierce anger of Yahweh toward Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you turn away from after him, he will yet again leave them in the wilderness; and you will destroy all these people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came near to him, and said, “We will build sheepfolds here for our livestock, and cities for our little ones;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but we ourselves will be ready armed to go before the children of Israel, until we have brought them to their place. Our little ones shall dwell in the fortified cities because of the inhabitants of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will not return to our houses until the children of Israel have all received their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we will not inherit with them on the other side of the Jordan and beyond, because our inheritance has come to us on this side of the Jordan eastward.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to them: “If you will do this thing, if you will arm yourselves to go before Yahweh to the war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and every one of your armed men will pass over the Jordan before Yahweh until he has driven out his enemies from before him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the land is subdued before Yahweh; then afterward you shall return, and be clear of obligation to Yahweh and to Israel. Then this land shall be your possession before Yahweh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if you will not do so, behold, you have sinned against Yahweh; and be sure your sin will find you out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Build cities for your little ones, and folds for your sheep; and do that which has proceeded out of your mouth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Gad and the children of Reuben spoke to Moses, saying, “Your servants will do as my lord commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our little ones, our wives, our flocks, and all our livestock shall be there in the cities of Gilead;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but your servants will pass over, every man who is armed for war, before Yahweh to battle, as my lord says.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses commanded concerning them to Eleazar the priest, and to Joshua the son of Nun, and to the heads of the fathers’ households of the tribes of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to them, “If the children of Gad and the children of Reuben will pass with you over the Jordan, every man who is armed to battle before Yahweh, and the land is subdued before you, then you shall give them the land of Gilead for a possession;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if they will not pass over with you armed, they shall have possessions among you in the land of Canaan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Gad and the children of Reuben answered, saying, “As Yahweh has said to your servants, so will we do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will pass over armed before Yahweh into the land of Canaan, and the possession of our inheritance shall remain with us beyond the Jordan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses gave to them, even to the children of Gad, and to the children of Reuben, and to the half-tribe of Manasseh the son of Joseph, the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites, and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan; the land, according to its cities and borders, even the cities of the surrounding land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Gad built Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Atroth-shophan, Jazer, Jogbehah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth Nimrah, and Beth Haran: fortified cities and folds for sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Reuben built Heshbon, Elealeh, Kiriathaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nebo, and Baal Meon, (their names being changed), and Sibmah. They gave other names to the cities which they built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Machir the son of Manasseh went to Gilead, took it, and dispossessed the Amorites who were therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses gave Gilead to Machir the son of Manasseh; and he lived therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jair the son of Manasseh went and took its villages, and called them Havvoth Jair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nobah went and took Kenath and its villages, and called it Nobah, after his own name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the journeys of the children of Israel, when they went out of the land of Egypt by their armies under the hand of Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses wrote the starting points of their journeys by the commandment of Yahweh. These are their journeys according to their starting points.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Rameses in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month; on the next day after the Passover, the children of Israel went out with a high hand in the sight of all the Egyptians,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while the Egyptians were burying all their firstborn, whom Yahweh had struck among them. Yahweh also executed judgments on their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of Israel traveled from Rameses, and encamped in Succoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Succoth, and encamped in Etham, which is in the edge of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Etham, and turned back to Pihahiroth, which is before Baal Zephon, and they encamped before Migdol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from before Hahiroth, and crossed through the middle of the sea into the wilderness. They went three days’ journey in the wilderness of Etham, and encamped in Marah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Marah, and came to Elim. In Elim, there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees, and they encamped there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Elim, and encamped by the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from the Red Sea, and encamped in the wilderness of Sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from the wilderness of Sin, and encamped in Dophkah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Dophkah, and encamped in Alush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Alush, and encamped in Rephidim, where there was no water for the people to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Rephidim, and encamped in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from the wilderness of Sinai, and encamped in Kibroth Hattaavah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Kibroth Hattaavah, and encamped in Hazeroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Hazeroth, and encamped in Rithmah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Rithmah, and encamped in Rimmon Perez.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Rimmon Perez, and encamped in Libnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Libnah, and encamped in Rissah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Rissah, and encamped in Kehelathah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Kehelathah, and encamped in Mount Shepher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Mount Shepher, and encamped in Haradah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Haradah, and encamped in Makheloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Makheloth, and encamped in Tahath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Tahath, and encamped in Terah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Terah, and encamped in Mithkah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Mithkah, and encamped in Hashmonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Hashmonah, and encamped in Moseroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Moseroth, and encamped in Bene Jaakan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Bene Jaakan, and encamped in Hor Haggidgad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Hor Haggidgad, and encamped in Jotbathah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Jotbathah, and encamped in Abronah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Abronah, and encamped in Ezion Geber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Ezion Geber, and encamped at Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Kadesh, and encamped in Mount Hor, in the edge of the land of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron the priest went up into Mount Hor at the commandment of Yahweh and died there, in the fortieth year after the children of Israel had come out of the land of Egypt, in the fifth month, on the first day of the month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron was one hundred twenty-three years old when he died in Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the South in the land of Canaan, heard of the coming of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Mount Hor, and encamped in Zalmonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Zalmonah, and encamped in Punon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Punon, and encamped in Oboth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Oboth, and encamped in Iye Abarim, in the border of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Iyim, and encamped in Dibon Gad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Dibon Gad, and encamped in Almon Diblathaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from Almon Diblathaim, and encamped in the mountains of Abarim, before Nebo.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traveled from the mountains of Abarim, and encamped in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They encamped by the Jordan, from Beth Jeshimoth even to Abel Shittim in the plains of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, “When you pass over the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall drive out all the inhabitants of the land from before you, destroy all their stone idols, destroy all their molten images, and demolish all their high places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take possession of the land, and dwell therein; for I have given the land to you to possess it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall inherit the land by lot according to your families; to the larger groups you shall give a larger inheritance, and to the smaller you shall give a smaller inheritance. Wherever the lot falls to any man, that shall be his. You shall inherit according to the tribes of your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land from before you, then those you let remain of them will be like pricks in your eyes and thorns in your sides. They will harass you in the land in which you dwell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall happen that as I thought to do to them, so I will do to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘When you come into the land of Canaan (this is the land that shall fall to you for an inheritance, even the land of Canaan according to its borders),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then your south quarter shall be from the wilderness of Zin along by the side of Edom, and your south border shall be from the end of the Salt Sea eastward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your border shall turn about southward of the ascent of Akrabbim, and pass along to Zin; and it shall pass southward of Kadesh Barnea; and it shall go from there to Hazar Addar, and pass along to Azmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border shall turn about from Azmon to the brook of Egypt, and it shall end at the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘For the western border, you shall have the great sea and its border. This shall be your west border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘This shall be your north border: from the great sea you shall mark out for yourselves Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Mount Hor you shall mark out to the entrance of Hamath; and the border shall pass by Zedad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the border shall go to Ziphron, and it shall end at Hazar Enan. This shall be your north border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You shall mark out your east border from Hazar Enan to Shepham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border shall go down from Shepham to Riblah, on the east side of Ain. The border shall go down, and shall reach to the side of the sea of Chinnereth eastward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The border shall go down to the Jordan, and end at the Salt Sea. This shall be your land according to its borders around it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses commanded the children of Israel, saying, “This is the land which you shall inherit by lot, which Yahweh has commanded to give to the nine tribes, and to the half-tribe;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the tribe of the children of Reuben according to their fathers’ houses, the tribe of the children of Gad according to their fathers’ houses, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two tribes and the half-tribe have received their inheritance beyond the Jordan at Jericho eastward, toward the sunrise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the names of the men who shall divide the land to you for inheritance: Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take one prince of every tribe, to divide the land for inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the men: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of the children of Simeon, Shemuel the son of Ammihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad the son of Chislon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of the children of Dan a prince, Bukki the son of Jogli.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the children of Joseph: of the tribe of the children of Manasseh a prince, Hanniel the son of Ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of the children of Ephraim a prince, Kemuel the son of Shiphtan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of the children of Zebulun a prince, Elizaphan the son of Parnach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of the children of Issachar a prince, Paltiel the son of Azzan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of the children of Asher a prince, Ahihud the son of Shelomi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of the children of Naphtali a prince, Pedahel the son of Ammihud.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are they whom Yahweh commanded to divide the inheritance to the children of Israel in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the children of Israel to give to the Levites cities to dwell in out of their inheritance. You shall give pasture lands for the cities around them to the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall have the cities to dwell in. Their pasture lands shall be for their livestock, and for their possessions, and for all their animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The pasture lands of the cities, which you shall give to the Levites, shall be from the wall of the city and outward one thousand cubits around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall measure outside of the city for the east side two thousand cubits, and for the south side two thousand cubits, and for the west side two thousand cubits, and for the north side two thousand cubits, the city being in the middle. This shall be the pasture lands of their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The cities which you shall give to the Levites, they shall be the six cities of refuge, which you shall give for the man slayer to flee to. Besides them you shall give forty-two cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the cities which you shall give to the Levites shall be forty-eight cities together with their pasture lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Concerning the cities which you shall give of the possession of the children of Israel, from the many you shall take many, and from the few you shall take few. Everyone according to his inheritance which he inherits shall give some of his cities to the Levites.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘When you pass over the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall appoint for yourselves cities to be cities of refuge for you, that the man slayer who kills any person unwittingly may flee there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cities shall be for your refuge from the avenger, that the man slayer not die until he stands before the congregation for judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cities which you shall give shall be for you six cities of refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall give three cities beyond the Jordan, and you shall give three cities in the land of Canaan. They shall be cities of refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These six cities shall be refuge for the children of Israel, for the stranger, and for the foreigner living among them, that everyone who kills any person unwittingly may flee there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘But if he struck him with an instrument of iron, so that he died, he is a murderer. The murderer shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he struck him with a stone in the hand, by which a man may die, and he died, he is a murderer. The murderer shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if he struck him with a weapon of wood in the hand, by which a man may die, and he died, he is a murderer. The murderer shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The avenger of blood shall himself put the murderer to death. When he meets him, he shall put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he shoved him out of hatred, or hurled something at him while lying in wait, so that he died,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or in hostility struck him with his hand, so that he died, he who struck him shall surely be put to death. He is a murderer. The avenger of blood shall put the murderer to death when he meets him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘But if he shoved him suddenly without hostility, or hurled on him anything without lying in wait,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or with any stone, by which a man may die, not seeing him, and cast it on him so that he died, and he was not his enemy and not seeking his harm,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the congregation shall judge between the striker and the avenger of blood according to these ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The congregation shall deliver the man slayer out of the hand of the avenger of blood, and the congregation shall restore him to his city of refuge, where he had fled. He shall dwell therein until the death of the high priest, who was anointed with the holy oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘But if the man slayer shall at any time go beyond the border of his city of refuge where he flees,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the avenger of blood finds him outside of the border of his city of refuge, and the avenger of blood kills the man slayer, he shall not be guilty of blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because he should have remained in his city of refuge until the death of the high priest. But after the death of the high priest, the man slayer shall return into the land of his possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘These things shall be for a statute and ordinance to you throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Whoever kills any person, the murderer shall be slain based on the testimony of witnesses; but one witness shall not testify alone against any person so that he dies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘Moreover you shall take no ransom for the life of a murderer who is guilty of death. He shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘You shall take no ransom for him who has fled to his city of refuge, that he may come again to dwell in the land before the death of the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘So you shall not pollute the land where you live; for blood pollutes the land. No atonement can be made for the land for the blood that is shed in it, but by the blood of him who shed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not defile the land which you inhabit, where I dwell; for I, Yahweh, dwell among the children of Israel.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The heads of the fathers’ households of the family of the children of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of the sons of Joseph, came near and spoke before Moses and before the princes, the heads of the fathers’ households of the children of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Yahweh commanded my lord to give the land for inheritance by lot to the children of Israel. My lord was commanded by Yahweh to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother to his daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they are married to any of the sons of the other tribes of the children of Israel, then their inheritance will be taken away from the inheritance of our fathers, and will be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they shall belong. So it will be taken away from the lot of our inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the jubilee of the children of Israel comes, then their inheritance will be added to the inheritance of the tribe to which they shall belong. So their inheritance will be taken away from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses commanded the children of Israel according to Yahweh’s word, saying, “The tribe of the sons of Joseph speak what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the thing which Yahweh commands concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, saying, ‘Let them be married to whom they think best, only they shall marry into the family of the tribe of their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So shall no inheritance of the children of Israel move from tribe to tribe; for the children of Israel shall all keep the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every daughter who possesses an inheritance in any tribe of the children of Israel shall be wife to one of the family of the tribe of her father, that the children of Israel may each possess the inheritance of his fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So shall no inheritance move from one tribe to another tribe; for the tribes of the children of Israel shall each keep his own inheritance.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The daughters of Zelophehad did as Yahweh commanded Moses:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, were married to their father’s brothers’ sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were married into the families of the sons of Manasseh the son of Joseph. Their inheritance remained in the tribe of the family of their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the commandments and the ordinances which Yahweh commanded by Moses to the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator
